title: Loukas Hadjiloukas
text:
Loukas Hadjiloukas (; born on 6 June 1967) is a <a href="Cyprus">Cypriot</a> football manager and former <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player.
He had a great career while playing for <a href="APOEL%20F.C.">APOEL</a>, in which he won three <a href="Cypriot%20First%20Division">Championships</a> (1990, 1992, 1996), 5 <a href="Cypriot%20Cup">Cups</a> (1993, 1995, 1996, 1997, 1999) and 4 <a href="LTV%20Super%20Cup">Super Cups</a> (1992, 1993, 1996, 1997).
He was the chief scout for <a href="APOEL%20F.C.">APOEL</a> for several years. He served as the manager of <a href="Digenis%20Akritas%20Morphou">Digenis Akritas Morphou</a> and <a href="ASIL%20Lysi">ASIL Lysi</a>. He became Cypriot First Division manager during November 2012, taking over <a href="Doxa%20Katokopias%20F.C.">Doxa Katokopias</a>.
